roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses

Class RepairKit

  • java.lang.Object
    • roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Element
        • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Item
          • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.RepairKit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEnergyHolder

    public class RepairKit
extends Item
implements IEnergyHolder
    A class of repair kits. Extends Item.
    Version:
    24 may 2012
    Author:
    Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven

    • Constructor Summary

      Initialize this new repair kit with the given position, board, amount of energy [Ws] and weight [g].

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
      Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this repair kit.

      Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this repair kit.

      Check whether the given maximum energy, expressed in watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy for this repair kit.

      Returns the variable representing the current amount if energy of this battery in the given energy unit.
      double getEnergyFraction()
      Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this repair kit can have.

      Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this repair kit can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].

      Recharges this repair kit with the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws].

      • RepairKit

        public RepairKit(Position position,
         Board board,
         double energyAmount,
         int weight)
        Initialize this new repair kit with the given position, board, amount of energy [Ws] and weight [g].
        Parameters:
        position - The position for this new element.
        board - The board on which this new element will be placed.
        energyAmount - The amount of energy for this new repair kit, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        weight - The weight for this new repair kit, expressed in grams [g].

      • canHaveAsEnergy

        public boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
        Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this repair kit.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        energy - The amount of energy to be checked, expressed in Watt-second.
        Returns:
        False if the given energy is greater than or equal to the maximal amount of energy an IEnergyHolder can have. | result != (energy > this.getMaxEnergy())

      • getMaxEnergy

        public final double getMaxEnergy()
        Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this repair kit can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Specified by:
        getMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder

      • setMaxEnergy

        public void setMaxEnergy(double maxEnergyAmount)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the maximum energy level of this repair kit to the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Specified by:
        setMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        maxEnergyAmount - The new maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder is terminated. | this.isTerminated()
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - When the maximum energy level of this IEnergeHolder cannot be altered. | ! (this instance of Robot)

      • canHaveAsMaxEnergy

        public boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
        Check whether the given maximum energy, expressed in watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy for this repair kit.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        maxEnergy - The maximum energy level to be checked, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        Returns:
        False if the given energy isn't a valid energy amount | result == EnergyAmount.isValidEnergyAmount(maxEnergy)

      • getEnergyFraction

        public double getEnergyFraction()
        Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this repair kit can have.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyFraction in interface IEnergyHolder
        Returns:
        A percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have. | result == (this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND)) / this.getMaxEnergy()) * 100

      • recharge

              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Specified by:

      • canAcceptForRecharge

        public boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
        Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this repair kit.
        Specified by:
        canAcceptForRecharge in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be checked, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Returns:
        False if this IEnergyHolder cannot have a total energy level equal to the given amount of energy added to its current energy level. | result == (this.canHaveAsEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + amount))

      • repair

        public void repair(IEnergyHolder other,
          double amount)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This repair kit repairs another IEnergyHolder bay increasing its maximum energy. When the other IEnergyHolder cannot alter its maximum energy, nothing is changed.
        Parameters:
        other - The IEnergyHolder to be given energy.
        amount - The amount of energy to be transferred, expressed Watt-second [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - ... | this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()

      • transferEnergy

        public void transferEnergy(IEnergyHolder other,
                  double amount)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Transfers the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], from this repair kit to another IEnergyHolder.
        Specified by:
        transferEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        other - The IEnergyHolder to be given energy.
        amount - The amount of energy to be transferred, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder or the other IEnergyHolder is terminated | this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - When this IEnergyHolder cannot transfer energy to another IEnergyHolder | ! this instanceof Battery

      • use

        public void use(Robot robot)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        The given robot uses this repair kit. As much energy as possible is transferred from this repair kit to the maximum energy level of the robot.
        Specified by:
        use in class Item
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that uses this repair kit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - ... | this.isTerminated() || robot.isTerminates()

      • takeHit

        public void takeHit()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered. A repair kit increases its energy with 500 Ws when hit if possible. Otherwise it is set to the maximum energy level.
        Specified by:
        takeHit in class Item
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this repair kit is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this repair kit.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Item
        Returns:
        ... | result == "Repair kit with:" + "\n" | + super.toString() + "\n" | + " energy level [Ws]: " + this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + "(" + getEnergyFraction() + "%)"
